title: Building a House
description: While building a small house you'll get to know the most common tools used in Fusion 360.

chapters.title: It begins with a Sketch
chapters.description: The most common way to create an object is by starting with creating a sketch. A sketch is a two-dimensional shape i.e. a circle or rectangle. To create the cubic part of the house we begin with a square sketch on the bottom plane
chapters.title: It Begins With a Sketch
chapters.description: The most common way to create an object is by starting with creating a sketch. A sketch is a two-dimensional shape (e.g. a circle or a rectangle). To create the cubic part of the house we begin with a square sketch on the bottom plane
chapters.thumbnailAlt: A screenshot of a sketched square.

steps.text: Click on the Create Sketch icon.
Inside the ___workspace___ click the orange square on the ___XY-plane___
tooltips: The workspace is the big area in the center of the Fusion 360 window where you can see your model and manipulate it.

The XY-plane is spanned by the X-axis (red) and the Y-axis (green). You can also determine which is the x, y, and z-ais by comparing position of the axes in the workspace with the axes on the cube in the upper right corner.

steps.text: Select the Center-Rectangle from the CREATE menu
Set the center of the rectangle by clicking on the intersection between the ___x-axis___ and the ___y-axis___
tooltips: The x-axis has a red color in the workspace
The y-axis has a green color in the workspace

steps.text: Specify a ___size___ of 100x100mm and click to confirm
tooltips: You can either use the mouse or press the Tabulator Key to switch between specifying width and height.

steps.text: Click on Finish Sketch

chapters.text: Set the center of the rectangle by clicking at the intersection of the x- and y-axis
Specify a size of 100x100 mm and click to confirm. You can press ___tabulator-key___ to switch between specifying width and height.
tooltips: On most keyboards the tabular-key, or short tab, is left to the Q

title: Let's get cubic
description: After a sketch is created, we want to build a three-dimensional shape from the two-dimensional sketch. The extrude feature represents a way to extrude these sketches into 3-dimensional shapes. We will extrude our quare sketch from the first chapter into a cube

steps.text: Select the Extrude Feature in the CREATE menu or in the right-click menu under Press/Pull or press the letter E on your keyboard
Drag your square ___upwards___ for a distance of a ___100mm___
tooltips: Along the y-axis that is represented in green
You may also just type 100 into the height box

steps.text: Confirm by clicking Ok in the command dialog or pressing Enter

title: Raise the roof
description: Now we want to create a roof by starting with a sketch again. We can create sketches on either selected planes or planes that are created by our components themselves. In this chapter we will create a sketch on the front of our cube.

steps.text: Click on the Create Sketch icon.
Select the ___front___ plane of our cube
tooltips: You can drag the cube in the right upper corner of the workspace to orientate in your design

steps.text: Select Line in the CREATE menu or press the L Button
Click on the upper left edge of our square plane
Click on the point of the ___y-axis___ such that the angle is 45Â°
tooltips: The y-axis has a green color in the workspace

steps.text: Click on the upper right edge of our square plane
Click on the upper left edge of our square plane again to finish the triangle
Click on Finish Sketch to confirm

title: Rain Protection
description: A simple triangle is not enough to protect our house from the rain. We need to extrude our triangle-roof just as we did with the square foundation of our house

steps.text: Click on the triangle sketch, we created in the last chapter
Select the Extrude Feature in the CREATE menu or in the right-click menu under Press/Pull or press the letter E on your keyboard
Drag the arrow to the back of the square or define a distance of -100mm
Click Ok in the command dialog or press Enter to confirm

title: Create some room
description: Our house consists of a solid block o material as of right now but we need place inside for people to live in. That is why we are going to hollow it out from the bottom. This is where the Shell Feature comes into play

steps.text: Select the Shell Feature from the MODIFY menu
Select the ___bottom___ plane of our house
tooltips: You can drag the cube in the right upper corner of the workspace to orientate in your design

steps.text: Drag the arrow or type a thickness of 10mm
Confirm by clicking Ok in the command dialog or pressing Enter

title: Make an Entrance
description: Every house needs a door. We will create an entrance by using the Extrude feature again but by dragging it in the opposite direction. But first we will have to create a sketch for the shape of the entrance.

steps.text: Click on the Create Sketch icon.
Select the 2-Point Rectangle from the CREATE menu or press the R Button
Create a ___50x40mm___ door in the bottom middle of the plane
tooltips: You can either use the mouse or press the Tabulator Key to switch between specifying width and height.

steps.text: Click on Finish Sketch to confirm
Select the Extrude Feature in the CREATE menu or in the right-click menu under Press/Pull or press the letter E on your keyboard
Select the entrance sketch
Drag the arrow inside the house of select a distance of at least ___-10mm___
tooltips: Because our walls have a thickness of 10mm

steps.text: Confirm by clicking Ok in the command dialog or pressing Enter
